text:
e="preserve">Betty Ann Bobbitt (February 7, 1939 – November 30, 2020) was an American-born Australian actress, director, singer, and playwright. She was born in New York City. Bobbitt's career began in 1957. She was known for her cameos in the "Crocodile Dundee" movie series playing American tourists. She also played Judy Bryant in the 1980s comedy "Prisoner".
Bobbitt died on November 30, 2020 in Melbourne from a stroke at the age of 81.
